title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must state that both the price level will decrease and explain why in order to receive the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that the price level will decrease and/or does not explain that the decrease in net exports shifts the aggregate demand curve to the left, which decreases both real output and the price level.

The response states that the price level will decrease and explains that the decrease in net exports shifts the aggregate demand curve to the left, which decreases both real output and the price level.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response should be consistent with the change in net exports in part (a).
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes the first criterion, but not the second.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response should be consistent with the change in the nominal interest rate shown in part (b).
descriptions: The response does not state that the price of previously issued bonds will increase.
The response states that the price of previously issued bonds will increase.

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response should be consistent with the change in the nominal interest rate shown in part (b).
descriptions: The response does not state that the central bank should sell bonds.
The response states that the central bank should sell bonds.
